department.dept_long_name: Department of Slavic Languages and Literatures

course.title: Intermediate Russian (Intensive)
course.meeting_text: M., W., F., at 9, Tu., Th., at 10, with speaking practice M., W., F., at 1. MWF small group practice times are tentative and efforts will be made to accommodate student schedules.
course.description: An intensive version of Russian B, covering the same material in a single semester. Class meets five days per week with five hours of the main section and three hours of small group speaking practice each week. Readings may vary.
course.prerequisites: Russian A, Aab, At, Ah, or placement at the B-level. Familiarity with fundamentals of Russian grammar, particularly case endings of the noun, pronoun, and adjective and elementary competence in spoken Russian.
course.notes: See "Sectioning Note" above. Class hours may be changed by agreement. Russian B, Russian Bab, and Russian Bt all prepare students to continue in Russian 101.
